responses.content:
```yaml
leads:
  - headline: Prototype Pollution Vulnerability in merge-object Function
    analysis: |
      The merge-object function in lib/merge-object.js implements object merging by directly assigning properties from one object (object2) to another (object1) without sufficient validation of the property names. This can lead to a prototype pollution attack if a malicious user controls the properties in object2 and sets properties like `__proto__`, potentially altering the prototype of object1. Such changes are global, affecting all objects inheriting properties from the altered prototype. This can lead to unintended behavior in applications, including arbitrary code execution, depending on how the objects are used.
    cwe: CWE-1321
    function_names:
      - exports
    filenames:
      - lib/merge-object.js
    classification: very promising
```

leads.headline: Prototype Pollution Vulnerability in merge-object Function
leads.analysis: The merge-object function in lib/merge-object.js implements object merging by directly assigning properties from one object (object2) to another (object1) without sufficient validation of the property names. This can lead to a prototype pollution attack if a malicious user controls the properties in object2 and sets properties like __proto__, potentially altering the prototype of object1. Such changes are global, affecting all objects inheriting properties from the altered prototype. This can lead to unintended behavior in applications, including arbitrary code execution, depending on how the objects are used.
